algorithm_technique: Row and column flipping logic based on the first row's state
problem_summary_simple: Determine if a binary matrix can be made all zeros by flipping rows and columns.
problem_summary_technical: Checks if each row is either identical to the first row or its bitwise complement.
key_insights: The state of the first row dictates the required state of all other rows.
Each subsequent row must either match the first row or be its exact inverse (after considering column flips).
This problem can be solved by checking consistency with the first row, as any valid sequence of flips can be mapped to this.
